channel.title: LLVM Developers' Meeting Proceedings
channel.itunes:author: Chris Hanson
channel.description: Proceedings of the LLVM Developers' Meeting.
channel.itunes:summary: Proceedings of the LLVM Developers' Meeting.

item.title: 2007-05: Adoption Goals
item.itunes:author: Chris Lattner
item.description: While our adoption has increased greatly recently, we're still tiny compared to other compiler and virtual machine systems.
item.itunes:subtitle: While our adoption has increased greatly recently, we're still tiny compared to other compiler and virtual machine systems.

item.title: 2007-05: LLVM Roadmap
item.itunes:author: Reid Spencer
item.description: Does the development community care to disclose and maintain advance information about what is being worked on?
item.itunes:subtitle: Does the development community care to disclose and maintain advance information about what is being worked on?

item.title: 2007-05: LLVM in OpenGL and for Dynamic Languages
item.itunes:author: Chris Lattner
item.description: A presentation put together in 10 minutes, talking about LLVM being used for OpenGL and some speculative talk about dynamic languages.
item.itunes:subtitle: A presentation put together in 10 minutes, talking about LLVM being used for OpenGL and some speculative talk about dynamic languages.

item.title: 2007-05: New LLVM C Front-end
item.itunes:author: Steve Naroff
item.description: This talk describes a new from-scratch C frontend (which is aiming to support Objective C and C++ someday) for LLVM, built as a native part of the LLVM system and in the LLVM design style.
item.itunes:subtitle: This talk describes a new from-scratch C frontend (which is aiming to support Objective C and C++ someday) for LLVM, built as a native part of the LLVM system and in the LLVM design style.

item.title: 2007-05: Secure Virtual Architecture
item.itunes:author: John Criswell
item.description: A presentation on our research to create a virtual machine that operates below the operating system and a brief introduction to some of the novel security capabilities that our architecture can enable.
item.itunes:subtitle: A presentation on our research to create a virtual machine that operates below the operating system and a brief introduction to some of the novel security capabilities that our architecture can enable.

item.title: 2007-05: HLVM
item.itunes:author: Reid Spencer
item.description: An overview of HLVM, its current status and its goals after integration with LLVM.
item.itunes:subtitle: An overview of HLVM, its current status and its goals after integration with LLVM.

item.title: 2007-05: Introduction To Predicate Simplifier
item.itunes:author: Nick Lewycky
item.description: A review of the design and implementation of LLVM's Predicate Simplifier Pass, otherwise known as VRP (Value Range Propagation).
item.itunes:subtitle: A review of the design and implementation of LLVM's Predicate Simplifier Pass, otherwise known as VRP (Value Range Propagation).

item.title: 2007-05: The LLVM Code Generator
item.itunes:author: Evan Cheng
item.description: An overview of the LLVM generic code generator design and changes to it that are coming in the future.
item.itunes:subtitle: An overview of the LLVM generic code generator design and changes to it that are coming in the future.

item.title: 2007-05: Demystifying the LLVM Pass Manager
item.itunes:author: Devang Patel
item.description: The PassManager, which manages the execution of all LLVM passes, was recently revised to be simpler and more useful. This talk will help you understand what the new pass manager does and how to use it.
item.itunes:subtitle: The PassManager, which manages the execution of all LLVM passes, was recently revised to be simpler and more useful. This talk will help you understand what the new pass manager does and how to use it.

item.title: 2007-05: Introductions
item.itunes:author: Everyone
item.description: Everyone introduced themselves to the group.
item.itunes:subtitle: Everyone introduced themselves to the group.

item.title: 2007-05: A brief history of LLVM
item.itunes:author: Vikram Adve, Chris Lattner
item.description: During this brief session, Vikram and Chris (the originators of LLVM) presented a brief history of the early history of LLVM.
item.itunes:subtitle: During this brief session, Vikram and Chris (the originators of LLVM) presented a brief history of the early history of LLVM.
